title: Midnight Bloom
description: A glowing, neon-lit journey through late-night synths and hushed vocals. It feels like driving with the windows down at 2am.
notes: Listened on a rainy Thursday. The production is lush without being overwhelming, and the sequencing keeps pulling me forward.

tracks.title: Streetlight Reverie
tracks.notes: Opener with a perfect rise-and-fall chorus. The bassline is addictive.

tracks.title: Velvet Skyline
tracks.notes: Smooth verses, shimmering hooks. Might be the best vocal take on the record.

tracks.title: Neon Rivers
tracks.notes: The drum groove keeps me locked in. Great layering in the bridge.

tracks.title: Afterglow
tracks.notes: A slow burn that hits hard by the final minute.

title: Sunset Polaroids
description: Warm guitar textures and nostalgic lyrics that feel like flipping through old photographs.
notes: Played this on a long weekend drive. The mid-album stretch is mellow but the closing track saves it.

tracks.title: Golden Hour
tracks.notes: Effortless hook. The slide guitar gives it a sun-soaked glow.

tracks.title: Paper Planes
tracks.notes: Pretty verses, the chorus doesn't fully land for me.

tracks.title: Harborview
tracks.notes: Great storytelling and a punchy outro.

tracks.title: Window Seat
tracks.notes: Quiet closer, feels like a soft exhale.
